name: SourceFileSegment
comment: A convenience type to treat a code segment as if it were a separate source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFile. A source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment shifts all locations by an offset, which allows you to set source-map locations based on the locations relative to the start of the segment, but that get translated to absolute locations in the original source file.

url.name: url
url.comment: Url where the source file is located.

getColumn.name: getColumn
getColumn.comment: Return the column on the underlying file associated with source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.getColumn.line and source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.getColumn.offset, where source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.getColumn.line is absolute from the beginning of the underlying file. This method operates on the real offsets from the original file, so that error messages can be reported accurately.

getLine.name: getLine
getLine.comment: Return the line on the underlying file associated with the source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.getLine.offset of the underlying file. This method operates on the real offsets from the original file, so that error messages can be reported accurately. When the requested offset is past the length of the segment, this returns the line number after the end of the segment (total lines + 1).

getOffset.name: getOffset
getOffset.comment: Return the offset associated with a line and column. This method operates on the real offsets from the original file, so that error messages can be reported accurately.

getText.name: getText
getText.comment: Retrieve the text associated with the specified range. This method operates on the real offsets from the original file, so that error messages can be reported accurately.

location.name: location
location.comment: Create a location, where source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.location.offset relative to this segment's base offset. The returned span stores the real offset on the file, so that error messages are reported at the real location.

span.name: span
span.comment: Craete a span, where source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.span.start is relative to this segment's base offset. The returned span stores the real offset on the file, so that error messages are reported at the real location.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

getColumn.name: getColumn
getColumn.comment: Gets the 0-based column corresponding to an offset.

getLine.name: getLine
getLine.comment: Gets the 0-based line corresponding to an offset.

getLocationMessage.name: getLocationMessage
getLocationMessage.comment: Create a pretty string representation from a span.

getOffset.name: getOffset
getOffset.comment: Get the offset for a given line and column

getText.name: getText
getText.comment: Gets the text at the given offsets.

location.name: location
location.comment: Returns a location in this source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFile with the given offset.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFileSegment.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

span.name: span
span.comment: Returns a span in this source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFile with the given offsets.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
